snippet: New York employees who work in Salvation Army programs that receive government funds will get a document stating that they need not adhere to the group’s religious principles on the job.
abstract: Salvation Army settles decade-old lawsuit that charged it with engaging in religious discrimination by requiring its government-funded social service employees to reveal their beliefs and to agree to act in accordance with the Christian gospel; as part of the settlement, group will distribute to workers in New York document stating that they need not adhere to its religious principles.
lead_paragraph: New York employees who work in Salvation Army programs that receive government funds will get a document stating that they need not adhere to the group’s religious principles on the job.

headline.main: Salvation Army Settles Lawsuit on Religious Discrimination
headline.print_headline: Salvation Army Settles Lawsuit on Religious Discrimination
